title: Introducing: Mentalease
content:
There’s been much made of the so called ‘shoegaze revival’ in recent years, with the likes of The Twilight Sad, The Horrors and The Pains Of Being Pure At Heart attempting to write a modern translation of the echo laden vocals and reverb doused guitars that stereotyped the late 80’s.

Whilst there were some valiant efforts (see Primary Colours), there was still an underlying feeling that they lacked a true understanding of the creative ethos that made shoegaze such an emotionally inspiring genre.

Take one listen to the riff on Mentalease’s Thoughts Seize and you’ll soon realize that Spencer Harris doesn’t just sympathize with the groundings of the genre; it’s practically a second language to him. It’s a riff that I’m sure My Bloody Valentine would be proud of, and that is truly the highest accolade anyone can offer a shoegaze fanatic. Entropy Rising, the debut five track release from Mentalease, the solo project of the aforementioned Spencer Harris is a glorious collection of tracks, and one of the finest EP’s I’ve heard in several years.

Elsewhere on the release there’s the sultry drone of Sleep Paralysis, the soundtrack to a dream you never had, and the vicious drive of opener Levitate, a track that’s both expansive yet wonderfully intimate. Backing female vocals lapse in and out across the course of the five tracks, adding a stunning level of inner conflict. It’s clear that these are extremely personal songs, yet by fashioning them in such a splendid way, Mentalease has allowed everyone a peak inside his world.

Check out my personal favourites below, Thoughts Seize and Sleep Paralysis, then head over to the Mentalease bandcamp to grab the whole EP for free.
